org.gephi.graph.utils

Class LongPacker

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.gephi.graph.utils.LongPacker

  • public final class LongPacker
extends Object
    Packing utility for non-negative long and int values. Originally developed for Kryo by Nathan Sweet. Modified for JDBM by Jan Kotek

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods

    • Method Detail

      • packLong

        public static int packLong(DataOutput os,
                           long value)
                    throws IOException
        Pack non-negative long into output stream. It will occupy 1-10 bytes depending on value (lower values occupy smaller space)
        Parameters:
        os - the data output
        value - the long value
        Returns:
        the number of bytes written
        Throws:
        IOException - if an error occurs with the stream

      • packLong

        public static int packLong(byte[] ba,
                           long value)
                    throws IOException
        Pack non-negative long into byte array. It will occupy 1-10 bytes depending on value (lower values occupy smaller space)
        Parameters:
        ba - the byte array
        value - the long value
        Returns:
        the number of bytes written
        Throws:
        IOException - if an error occurs with the stream

        Returns:
        the long value

      • unpackLong

        public static long unpackLong(byte[] ba,
                              int index)
        Unpack positive long value from the byte array.

        The index value indicates the index in the given byte array.

        Parameters:
        ba - byte array
        index - index in ba
        Returns:
        the long value

      • packInt

        public static int packInt(DataOutput os,
                          int value)
                   throws IOException
        Pack non-negative int into output stream. It will occupy 1-5 bytes depending on value (lower values occupy smaller space)
        Parameters:
        os - the data output
        value - the value
        Returns:
        the number of bytes written
        Throws:
        IOException - if an error occurs with the stream
